text:
Y'all I am overwhelmed with what I don't know. Navigating this group has made me poignantly aware of my lack of knowledge. I think I've officially leapt from curious to panicky.

So, what do you think is a good orientation resource for building an agency? Like many of you (I suspect), I sort of stumbled into this agency life. But now I'm honing in on a philosophy and a set of services.

We want to build a content agency that's focused on community efforts. So there's creative in there, conversion/optimization, and community management. Anchor content pieces mostly focused on creating culture and training, and amplification of those pieces. That's all I know, or at least it's a plot I'm holding loosely in my mind.

Anyway, are there books I should read that are a rough roadmap to turning that into a business? Courses? This industry seems to have so much making it up as you go that there are few standards I can latch onto. Which is probably good in some ways, but it's making me so anxious. I need someone to iterate off of.

Apologies for the rant, especially if this is the wrong forum or it's already been answered 100 times. Thank you in advance for any direction to resources. I'm happy to do the work once I know where I'm headed.

text: I'm just here to confess I help lead a small marketing agency and many of the posts in here go over my head or just refer to things not on my radar. But we do good work, keep our clients happy, and keep adding new ones, so that's what matters!

elements.text: I'm just here to confess I help lead a small marketing agency and many of the posts in here go over my head or just refer to things not on my radar. But we do good work, keep our clients happy, and keep adding new ones, so that's what matters!

text: I appreciate that. Honestly, there's so much making it up as we go. I'm mostly comfortable with that but I do occasionally feel overwhelmed with the path ahead. This group has helped me see how many options there are in this space. It's been positive for sure.

elements.text: I appreciate that. Honestly, there's so much making it up as we go. I'm mostly comfortable with that but I do occasionally feel overwhelmed with the path ahead. This group has helped me see how many options there are in this space. It's been positive for sure.

text: Does anyone have any recs for worker's compensation insurance? I'm about to hire my first employee and my organization is 100% remote but I've been advised that this is necessary!

elements.text: Does anyone have any recs for worker's compensation insurance? I'm about to hire my first employee and my organization is 100% remote but I've been advised that this is necessary!

text: following. hoping to make our first hire early next year

elements.text: following. hoping to make our first hire early next year

text: We went through Hartford. And yeah, it’s absolutely necessary. Paid a $4000 fine earlier this year because of it. :upside_down_face:

elements.text: We went through Hartford. And yeah, it’s absolutely necessary. Paid a $4000 fine earlier this year because of it.

text:
I feel you on this! I had no idea what I was actually getting into when we launched — I knew some stuff, but I bit off way more than I thought I was!

Book recommendations:
• Traction by Gino Wickman (I'm just starting this, but it was recommended by another agency owner as the #1 tool she used to structure her SEO agency)
• Radical Candor by Kim Scott (great resource on how to best manage people)
I know those aren't content marketing specific, but they're what I got. :sweat_smile:

I also think it's probably more important to listen to your clients and take advantage of their feedback more than iterating on what another agency is doing. Ask clients — or even potential/ideal clients — what they need, what they don't need, what kind of agency experience they've had that ended up positive/negative/etc.

The other thing that's been helpful has just been connecting with other people in content marketing. My business is honestly 10x better at the end of 2021 than the beginning of this year, and I owe much of it to communities like this one. I'm also in a small agency owner group that gets together once a month to bounce ideas, rant, ask for advice, etc. and both have been super encouraging to me.

And feel free to shoot me a DM if you just want to chat! I'm not the world’s best, nor do I own a massive agency or have it all figured out.. but I love sharing anything I can that's helpful. :relaxed:
